page.title: 01Changes in Irvine Town.
page.content: Irvine Development Corporation was formed to plan new industry, houses and amenities for the extra population in Irvine when Irvine was designated as a{'New Town'}by the government. { Factory sites}were kept near to the main roads to make communication easier. Housing areas had to be close to factories to allow easy travel to and from work.{Community Centres}were chosen to create a neighbourhood spirit. These centres were often made from existing farm buildings, and social, recreational and cultural pursuits can be enjoyed within each. {Local Parks}were made to include football pitches, play areas, BMX tracks, roller skating parks and anything else people wanted. Housing schemes were designed to cut down traffic flow so that it was safer for children to play.
